chunks.original_text: 若不修行真地法者，忧悲苦恼，诸患无常，是生是死，烦恼切身。 善男子，若有众生，心得见了威德智慧，能伏难伏，能见难见，能闻难闻，能修难修，一切法相得见自在，而无分别。 为是义故，无分无别，具足功德。 尔时，天尊复说偈言： 我说真地义，希有无上法，徧满最胜理，恒流及无摄。 无异无染净，种种分别说。 不增减种智，自在归依义。 自在业大利，修持光妙尊。 空有无分有，由如世间性。 尔时，天尊说偈颂已，复告方城胜因童子：善男子，往昔过去，我所未证出世经法，令始得证无量因缘，有大庆悦，恒相续生，得行此经，思惟义味，为诸众生渐次成就。 善男子，海空智藏为诸众生，随其根性，我以法雨、常雨，能除众生烦恼燋热，能洗众生三障垢尘，生长众生一乘善根，利益一切若人非人。 善男子，譬如甘雨，润於一切，若山若泽，若高若下，是诸草木，无不蒙益。 善男子，譬如稻谷，能生芽茎，长生花果，结实甘露，施於四方，一切众生，无不饱足。 善男子，我今演说作善因缘，普令一切诸众生等，生长一乘海空宝藏，亦复如是。 善男子，当施是法，为他演说一乘海空秘密宝藏，思惟义味，讲说空义，令诸众生，若善男子、若善女人，发回向心，於三宝前顶礼尊足，起种种心，发种种意，穷诸所有，一心恭敬，以妙宝花，以妙宝香，赍持供养，发露忏悔。 善男子，作是思惟，是大利益，身得金刚，永无动转，住天中天，常乐 净土，得微妙果。 尔时，天尊复以偈曰： 善哉善男子，方城法胜因。 善巧请正法，自利及利他。 我今为汝说，善思善受持。 若善男子女，敬仰受持想。 甘露徧空身，白日升天堂。 若男若女等，矫心生诽谤。 生得赤病尸，死入无底狱。 有行是经者，自净如青莲。 由智及信心，顶礼真实义。 注道普念师，得升烦恼城。 以是因缘故，观法普皆空。 智道是清净，为世良福田。 人闻智胜师，由如大良医。 医治有病子，诸患皆悉除。 方城胜童子，无上大慧师。 海空智藏故，亦如化生王。 是第一希有，汝等善男子。 如化生大王，是因缘久远。 我故如是法，行善投於中。 广大如空地，成就世间王。 清净微妙果，汝等善男子。 汝为世间师，至心应顶礼。 求至常道果，圣道弟子众。 众作世间依，为作世间药。 总治邪慢人，退悲舍修道。 长沦三途中，万劫悔无益。 汝说有所利，正理非所证。 真人童子等，依止日光明。 照了诸法相，无动及出世。 我为等宣说，正法真实义。 亦如净日月，甚深了种种。 是我依经典，能令聪慧入。 下心起尊敬，细密难通法。 善知无碍着，利於八世法。 心常无染着，无碍名称说。 通愍恒受持，人天普识知。 顶礼大师足，辩说常无常。 兴雨甘露药，依止随分解。 犹如毛羽鸟，披阅次定城。 以择摄大乘，愿此言利益。 流布苦海人，法人及法义。 性略及广名，不净净究竟。 故称无等王，通达法界善。 得生大道常，由缘极通法。 人法二无忘，由无分别知。 从无倒智生，由如道广说。 所安立法良，正明修慧体。 二智寂靖乡，由如无量数。 百千万劫殃，依数恒修习。 今所得转王，若能善修道。 一念悉皆长，犹如梵天人。 侍从天尊力，普现种种门。 得种常无量，在道方便中。
chunks.translated_text:
If one does not cultivate the true Dharma of the Real Ground, they will be beset by sorrow, grief, suffering, and affliction—all impermanent ills—bound to birth and death, with afflictions clinging to the body.

Good son, if there are beings whose minds attain clear vision of majestic wisdom and power, who can subdue what is hard to subdue, see what is hard to see, hear what is hard to hear, and practice what is hard to practice, they will perceive all dharmic appearances with sovereign freedom, yet without discrimination. For this reason, they become undivided and non-differentiated, replete with merit and virtue.

Then the Heavenly Worthy spoke these verses:

I expound the meaning of the Real Ground,
The rare and supreme Dharma,
Pervading the most excellent principle,
Ever-flowing and ungrasped.
Without distinction, without defilement or purity,
Variously explained through discriminations.
Neither increasing nor diminishing the wisdom of all modes,
The meaning of refuge in sovereign freedom.
Sovereign action yields great benefit,
Cultivating the radiant and wondrous honored one.
Emptiness and existence are without divided being,
Just as the nature of the world.

When the Heavenly Worthy had finished reciting the verses, he again addressed the youth of Victorious Causes in Square City: Good son, in the distant past, before I had realized the transcendental scriptures and teachings, I now begin to attain boundless causes and conditions, filled with great joy and ceaseless delight. By practicing this sutra, contemplating its meaning and flavor, I gradually perfect all beings.

Good son, the Treasury of Oceanic Emptiness and Wisdom, for the sake of all beings, adapts to their root capacities. With the rain of Dharma, I constantly pour forth, able to dispel the scorching heat of afflictions in beings, to wash away the dust and filth of the three obstructions, to nurture the single-vehicle roots of goodness in beings, and to benefit all—whether human or non-human.

Good son, it is like sweet rain that moistens all things, whether mountains or marshes, high or low. All grasses and trees receive its benefit without exception.

Good son, it is like rice grains that sprout stems, grow flowers and fruits, and yield sweet dew, bestowing nourishment in all directions. All beings are sated without exception.

Good son, I now expound the causes and conditions of good action, universally enabling all beings to cultivate and grow the single-vehicle Treasury of Oceanic Emptiness, just like this.

Good son, you should bestow this Dharma, expounding for others the secret treasury of the single-vehicle Ocean of Emptiness. Contemplate its meaning and flavor, teach the meaning of emptiness, so that all beings—whether good sons or good daughters—may arouse the mind of dedication, prostrate before the Three Jewels, reverently touch the honored feet, generate manifold thoughts, and form manifold intentions. Exhausting all they possess, with single-minded reverence, they offer fine blossoms and fragrant incense, presenting these in devotion and making open confession.

Good son, by such contemplation, this brings great benefit. The body becomes adamantine, forever unshakable, abiding as the Heaven among Heavens, ever dwelling in the Pure Land, attaining the subtle and wondrous fruit.

Then the Heavenly Worthy again spoke in verse:

Excellent, good son,
Victor of Square City, master of Dharma causes.
Skillfully requesting the true teaching,
Benefiting self and others.
I now speak for you,
Think well and receive it with care.
If good sons and daughters
Revere and uphold it with devotion,
Sweet dew pervades the empty body,
And they ascend to heaven in broad daylight.
But if men or women
Deceive with perverse minds and slander,
They contract red disease in life,
And at death fall into the bottomless hell.
Those who practice this sutra
Purify themselves like blue lotuses.
Through wisdom and faith,
They bow to the true and real meaning.
Mindfully invoking the universal teacher,
They ascend the city of afflictions.
For this reason,
They contemplate all dharmas as universally empty.
The wisdom of the Dao is pure,
A fine field of blessings for the world.
Those who hear the wisdom of the Victorious Teacher
Are like great physicians.
They heal the sick child,
Dispelling all afflictions.
Victor of Square City, youth of supreme wisdom,
Because of the Treasury of Oceanic Wisdom,
You are like a magically born king.
This is the foremost rarity,
Good sons, for you.
Like the magically born great king,
These causes and conditions are long-standing.
Therefore, I teach this Dharma,
To practice goodness and enter therein.
Vast as the empty earth,
It perfects the king of the world.
The pure and subtle fruit,
Good sons, is for you.
You are the teacher of the world,
With utmost sincerity, you should bow in reverence.
Seek the fruit of the eternal Dao,
Assembly of disciples on the sacred path.
You act as the world’s refuge,
As medicine for the world.
In total, you cure the arrogant and haughty,
Who abandon compassion and forsake cultivation.
Long sunk in the three paths,
Even after ten thousand kalpas, remorse is useless.
You speak of what is beneficial,
But the true principle is not what they realize.
True persons, youths, and others,
Rely on the radiance of the sun.
Illuminating all dharmic appearances,
Unmoving and transcendent.
I proclaim equally,
The true meaning of the true Dharma.
Like the pure sun and moon,
Profoundly illuminating all things.
This is my reliance on the scriptures,
Enabling the wise to enter.
With humble mind, arise in reverence,
For the subtle and hard-to-fathom Dharma.
Skillfully knowing without attachment,
Beneficial to the eight worldly concerns.
The mind is ever without defilement,
Spoken of as unobstructed renown.
Ever compassionate, ever upholding,
Known by humans and devas alike.
Bow at the feet of the great teacher,
Who discourses on the constant and inconstant.
Pouring forth the sweet dew of medicine,
Relying on and understanding according to capacity.
Like a feathered bird,
You peruse the city of concentration in order.
Selecting and embracing the Great Vehicle,
May these words bring benefit.
Disseminating to those in the sea of suffering,
To the Dharma persons and the meaning of Dharma.
Nature, summary, and extensive names,
From impurity to ultimate purity.
Thus called the peerless king,
Who thoroughly understands the goodness of the Dharma realm.
Attaining birth in the eternal Great Dao,
Through conditions of supreme penetration.
Neither forgetting persons nor dharmas,
Through the knowledge of non-discrimination.
From the wisdom of non-inversion,
As the Dao is broadly expounded.
The good Dharma established for peace,
The essence of cultivation and wisdom.
The two wisdoms dwell in tranquil repose,
Like the measureless and boundless.
The misfortunes of a hundred thousand kalpas,
Constantly cultivated in accord with number.
Now, having attained the wheel-turning king,
If one can skillfully cultivate the Dao,
In a single thought, all is perfected,
Like the Brahma devas.
Attended by the power of the Heavenly Worthy,
Universally manifesting manifold doors.
Attaining boundless and constant seeds,
Within the expedient means of the Dao.

chunks.original_text: 通达永无相，名义互为客。 真人应习常，二观恒思量。 登彼亦无弘，从此生实智。 得离於尘增，若见诸非有。 得入於无崩，真人常清净。 不悦亦不荣，舍离外尘相。 得入智藏城，入所取非有。 次第方便生，利益无有碍。 尔时，天尊说此偈已，语胜因言：善男子，若有众生观诸法空，一切空性，空性无我，亦无世界，亦无空空。 譬如众生，欲观诸色，前色已空，后色亦空，是名空空，须臾之间复无量烦恼，亦复如是。 善男子，先修小道，小道既空，次修中道； 中道既空，次修上道； 上道既空，以是因绿，是名空空。 以是空故，常乐无为。 善男子，譬如金师冶炼真金，先除粗垢，次除微尘，后得名为百炼真金。 善男子，冶炼身心，求无上道，亦复如是。 善男子，说名方便，由此无定，以无定故，真人童子随欲成就微妙道法，缘境如意，能得久住。 善男子，未得令得，已得令满，已满不退。 见在当来，所有受生及行如是处，多得利益。 善男子，一切众生及行如是，具足功德。 天尊出世，得闻正法，名胜生处，此由定故。 真人童子於胜生处，得取住舍，随意运用，无退无转，声徧二乘。 一切众生，若人非人，同心瞻仰真人童子最胜生处，必得自在微妙国土，化於他土，无去无来，无生无灭，自在无碍，舍生欲生，生已称住。 善男子，随住久近，舍生舍灭，随其生生，欲生欲灭，随引分别，能令无碍神通力故。 善男子，一切众生无边世界住烦恼城，各求生生，贪欲爱色，以是因缘，生灭灭生，常生常灭，轮转生死。 吾当爱故，故现无碍，真人本愿，力无分别，神通如意，为诸众生说大法要，普令众生，未见未闻，令得见闻。 於是天尊以大慈悲，即便敛容，观察机缘，各随其感，则放光明，照於十方国土世界，令诸有缘一切众生成就其心，安稳听法； 故放光明，照於囚徒、饿鬼、地狱，若亲非亲，悉皆瞻见，一切众生悉从光明得见十方九幽地狱。 复见天尊演说法音，声徧虚空，作诸天人，化度众生，随其机感，普现威神光明。 天尊坐宝莲花，种种光明，而为说法，为度众生，由如大惠，徧无量界，现种种身，度一切苦。 是诸众生，悉皆随意听受正法，微妙一乘海空智藏，功德巍巍不可思议。 善男子，威神之力，随识转变，迅若电光，往还速疾，无可比类。 若有一人得睹真境，寂静无为，於一念间发无上道，心更不退，一切罪垢悉得尽除。 善恶之业皆由於心，由心既空，心识亦空； 心识既空，转变亦空。 以是因缘，心识速变，过於疾风，难见难闻。 此由心识所为之处，随念即成。 如此心者，观无有我，乃能包含。 善男子，由如镜像，大小俱照，无不睹见。 我心观见，亦复如是。 一切之有，甚多甚多，皆现身中。 善男子，迷惑众生守迷不返，牢着妄说。 我即观机，如金刚护，令知宿命，因果因缘。 或生饥馑，世有疾病，有疾医治。 亦如真人所受安乐，普令一切诸众生故，平等皆令。 善男子，若有信心，於善无厌，但为求法，无所爱惜，我当助劝，为说一乘海空宝藏，消除众生烦恼火城，如火炽盛，难当无敌。 若有众生求欲圆满，心无疲倦，除恶进善，一心受持，於恶知止，於善无厌，法相如是，我当为说。
chunks.translated_text:
Perceiving the eternally formless,
Names and meanings become mutual guests.
The true person should constantly practice,
In the two contemplations ever reflecting.

Ascending yet without grandeur,
From this arises true wisdom.
Attaining departure from dust’s increase,
As one sees all as non-existent.

Entering the uncollapsing,
The true person remains ever pure.
Neither delighting nor glorying,
Abandoning external dust-marks.

Entering the city of wisdom’s treasury,
What is grasped is non-existent.
Gradual expedient means arise,
Benefiting without obstruction.

At that time, the Heavenly Worthy, having spoken this verse, addressed Śubhahetu:
"Good son, if there are beings who contemplate the emptiness of all dharmas—
all emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness—
there is no self, nor world, nor even empty emptiness.
For example, when beings wish to perceive forms,
the prior form is already empty, the subsequent form is also empty;
this is called empty emptiness.
In a single moment, countless afflictions arise, and so it is likewise.

Good son, first cultivate the lesser Dao, and when the lesser Dao is empty,
then cultivate the middle Dao;
when the middle Dao is empty, then cultivate the higher Dao;
when the higher Dao is empty, through this condition,
this is called empty emptiness.
Through this emptiness, one abides in constant bliss and non-action.

Good son, it is like a goldsmith refining pure gold:
first removing coarse impurities, then fine dust,
until it is called hundred-times refined true gold.
Good son, refining body and mind to seek the supreme Dao is likewise.

Good son, this is called expedient means.
Through its lack of fixation,
and because of this lack of fixation,
the true person and divine youth may accomplish the subtle Dao and dharmas at will,
responding to conditions as they wish, and abiding long therein.

Good son, those not yet attained are enabled to attain,
those attained are enabled to fulfill,
and those fulfilled do not regress.
In present and future lives,
wherever they are born and wherever they practice,
they receive manifold benefits.

Good son, all beings who practice thus
are replete with merit and virtue.
When the Heavenly Worthy appears in the world,
they hear the true Dharma—
this is called the supreme birthplace.
This arises from concentration.

The true person and divine youth,
in the supreme birthplace,
attain a dwelling and abode,
using it at will without regression or deviation,
their fame pervading the two vehicles.
All beings—human and non-human—
with one mind gaze upon the supreme birthplace of the true person and divine youth,
and must attain the wondrous and autonomous land,
transforming other lands,
without going or coming,
without birth or extinction,
autonomous and unimpeded,
abandoning birth and desiring birth,
once born, abiding in attainment.

Good son, according to the duration of their abiding,
they abandon birth and abandon extinction;
according to their births and lives,
they desire birth and desire extinction,
responding to conditions with discernment,
enabling unimpeded divine powers.

Good son, all beings in the boundless worlds,
dwelling in the city of afflictions,
each seeking birth after birth,
craving desire and clinging to form—
through these conditions,
they are born and extinguished, extinguished and born,
constantly born, constantly extinguished,
revolving in birth and death.

Out of my love for them,
I manifest unimpeded,
through the original vow of the true person,
the power of non-discrimination,
divine powers as they wish,
proclaiming the great essential Dharma to all beings,
enabling those who have not seen or heard to see and hear.

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy, with great compassion,
composed his countenance, observed the conditions,
and responded to each according to their karmic connections,
then emitted radiant light,
illuminating the lands and worlds of the ten directions,
enabling all sentient beings with karmic affinity to fulfill their aspirations
and listen to the Dharma in peace.
Thus, he emitted light,
illuminating prisoners, hungry ghosts, and hell-beings—
whether kin or not—
all beheld,
and all beings saw the hells of the nine darknesses in the ten directions.

They further saw the Heavenly Worthy expounding the Dharma,
his voice pervading empty space,
manifesting as gods and humans,
transforming and delivering beings,
responding to conditions with universally manifested divine light.

The Heavenly Worthy, seated upon a precious lotus,
surrounded by manifold lights,
expounded the Dharma,
delivering beings with great kindness,
pervading the measureless realms,
manifesting various forms
to deliver all from suffering.

All these beings,
each according to their wishes,
received the true Dharma—
the wondrous One Vehicle, the treasury of sea-like emptiness and wisdom,
its merit majestic and inconceivable.

Good son, the power of divine majesty
transforms according to consciousness,
swift as lightning,
coming and going with speed beyond compare.
If even one person beholds the true realm,
tranquil and non-active,
in a single thought awakens the supreme Dao,
their mind never regressing,
all karmic defilements completely eradicated.

Good and evil karma both arise from the mind;
when the mind is empty, mental consciousness is also empty;
when mental consciousness is empty, transformation is also empty.
Through this condition,
the mind’s consciousness transforms swiftly,
surpassing the speed of wind,
difficult to see, difficult to hear.
This arises from the mind’s activity,
instantly accomplishing what is contemplated.

Such a mind,
contemplating the absence of self,
can encompass all.
Good son, it is like a mirror’s reflection,
reflecting both large and small,
nothing unseen.
My mind’s perception is likewise.
All that exists—
so very, very much—
all appears within this body.

Good son, deluded beings cling to delusion without return,
firmly attached to false doctrines.
I observe their conditions,
like a vajra guard,
enabling them to know past lives,
causes and conditions.
Some are born in famine,
some in times of disease,
some with illness and medical treatment.
Just as the true person receives peace and bliss,
I universally enable all beings
to attain equality.

Good son, if there are those with faith,
insatiable in goodness,
seeking only the Dharma,
with nothing cherished,
I shall assist and encourage them,
proclaiming the One Vehicle treasury of sea-like emptiness,
dispelling the burning city of beings’ afflictions—
like a raging fire, unbearable and invincible.
If there are beings who seek perfection,
their minds untiring,
abandoning evil and advancing in goodness,
single-mindedly upholding,
knowing when to cease evil,
insatiable in goodness—
such is the mark of the Dharma.
I shall proclaim it for them."

chunks.original_text: 善男子，汝今眷属，应当一心发大乘智，离有离无，以是因缘，有无空 净，是灭本识亦空，本识空故，法相续生。 善男子，若有众生能如是者，即破诸惑。 所以者何？ 大哀天尊随於众生一切根性及烦恼性，为在种种微妙法相。 若人非人，若有一人执心空见，空法不离，疑惑正法，於中现世空无所得，若观此法，说同一真，亦如一味，现世得安，成就道果。 尔时，天尊复告方城王子胜因：善男子，汝於往昔无量劫时，修行一乘海空智藏。 以是因缘，乃於今日得证一乘海空智藏微妙功德，真是医王，希有希有。 汝名胜因，有善方术，医治诸子，解说善根。 以是因缘，汝名胜因。 善男子，汝有广愿，具足功德，云何广愿？ 一者常愿，愿大供养，常以供养於彼胜福及法师说。 二者常愿，愿我是等一心受持胜妙正法。 三者常愿，转大法轮，愿於大众常转法轮。 四者常愿，心修行愿，愿常说法，一切圣贤、真人童子，普得闻见。 五者常愿，成就国土一切众生，当得安稳，三乘善根。 六者常愿，承事心愿，愿大哀天尊住於诸国，见诸道士常恒恭敬，听受正法。 七者常愿，得 净土国，安立法教，修行护念，一切是诸众生当得安稳。 八者常愿，不离一切诸众生等，不离仙道，真人童子同意勤行。 九者常愿，利益一切，普蒙荫覆，无有空过。 十者常愿，了觉正道，化诸众生，同得正果。 善男子，如是十种微妙上愿，能修之者，至登胜地，至得成立。 何以故？ 如此愿者，真是同得清 净国土。 善男子，我已得之清净国土，故出离於生死秽土。 善男子，亦如龙王十二缘生，或生不生，或不生生； 或生生，或非生生，或非不生，各随物宜而为演说。 善男子，复有缘生，有法名染，无法名 净。 善男子，汝今当知无上真事微妙正法，说真说实。 云何而言说真戒者？ 善男子，是真戒者，《八素》、《四明》俱归是一。 汝今眷属皆应观之，是经探奥，汝谛受持其中微妙细密之意。 一清 净戒，即是性戒，自性恒净，能持已犯，已发露心，还受清净。 汝等次观一信清净，二心清净，三身清净，发无上道，身心清净。 始是明行，众行之宗。 得清净故，以大慈悲，故起众行，了见道法清 净无碍。 由实晓明，微妙之宗，通达真理，境智无差，即名为道。 所以者何？ 达真道故。 道应化身，当授学师。 善男子，受持正教，修习正行，如是之子，名为无上第一导师，普令众生得成熟之，晓了道相。 种种念愿，使诸众生求觅真一自然道果，使诸当来一切众生乐弘上道，演说一乘海空智藏，使诸众生起平等利，希有希有，心住功德，坚固自身，离於五尘，舍爱着心，守护根性，住无上天常乐之地，安稳不动。 善男子，若有一人舍爱着心，守护六根，不令作恶，当令此人住四念果，於念通了甚深妙法，不起疑谤，心如莲华，色中鲜明，不着诸尘，生爱念想。 若观此色空无所有，犹如化生大王王子，诸德清 净，生道国土，有能摧伏，以威德力，求法出家，身心清净，离烦恼城，登上方界，亲侍神尊，深了诸法空净非有，亦非有净，非不有净。 何以故？ 一切众生未得空解，二观有故，未得微妙深定慧力。 善男子，汝今眷属既得出家，汝於所得深妙法中起爱着心，由爱着故，不得清 净。

"Good son, now your retinue should single-mindedly awaken the great wisdom of the Mahāyāna, transcending both existence and non-existence. Through this cause and condition, existence and non-existence become empty and pure. When the root consciousness is extinguished, it too is empty. Because the root consciousness is empty, the marks of dharmas arise in continuity.

Good son, if there are beings who can do this, they will shatter all delusions. Why is this so? The Great Compassionate Heavenly Worthy adapts to the faculties and afflictions of all beings, manifesting in various subtle and wondrous dharma-marks. Whether human or non-human, if even one person clings to the view of emptiness, not departing from the empty dharma, they will doubt the true Dharma. In this present life, they will gain nothing from emptiness. If one contemplates this Dharma, proclaiming it as one with the true reality, like a single flavor, they will attain peace in this life and accomplish the fruition of the Way.

At that time, the Heavenly Worthy again addressed Prince Victorious Cause of the Square City: Good son, in measureless kalpas past, you cultivated the treasury of wisdom of the One Vehicle’s sea-like emptiness. Through this cause and condition, you have now realized the subtle and wondrous merit of the treasury of wisdom of the One Vehicle’s sea-like emptiness. Truly a King of Physicians—rare indeed, rare indeed! Your name is Victorious Cause, for you possess excellent methods and arts, healing the children and expounding the roots of goodness. For this reason, your name is Victorious Cause.

Good son, you have vast vows and perfect merit. What are these vast vows? First, the constant vow: to make great offerings, always offering to those of supreme merit and to the Dharma-teachers. Second, the constant vow: that I and others single-mindedly uphold the supreme and wondrous true Dharma. Third, the constant vow: to turn the great Dharma-wheel, always turning the wheel of Dharma in the great assembly. Fourth, the constant vow: to cultivate the vow of practice, always expounding the Dharma, so that all sages, true persons, and youths universally hear and see it. Fifth, the constant vow: to perfect all beings in the realm, so that they attain peace and the roots of goodness of the Three Vehicles. Sixth, the constant vow: to serve with the vow of the mind, that the Great Compassionate Heavenly Worthy abides in all lands, seeing all Daoists with constant reverence, listening to and receiving the true Dharma. Seventh, the constant vow: to attain a pure land, establishing the Dharma-teaching, cultivating and protecting mindfulness, so that all these beings attain peace. Eighth, the constant vow: never to depart from all beings, never to depart from the immortal Dao, practicing diligently together with true persons and youths. Ninth, the constant vow: to benefit all universally, sheltering them without fail. Tenth, the constant vow: to awaken to the true Way, transforming all beings to attain the same true fruition.

Good son, those who cultivate these ten subtle and supreme vows will ascend to the supreme ground and attain accomplishment. Why is this? Because such vows truly lead to the attainment of a pure land. Good son, I have already attained this pure land, thus emerging from the defiled land of birth and death.

Good son, it is like the Dragon King’s twelve links of dependent origination: sometimes arising from non-arising, sometimes non-arising from arising; sometimes arising from arising, sometimes non-arising from non-arising, or neither arising nor non-arising—each expounded according to what is fitting for beings. Good son, there is also dependent origination where dharmas with marks are called defiled, and dharmas without marks are called pure.

Good son, you should now know that the supreme and true matter of the wondrous true Dharma speaks of true reality and truth. How then does one speak of true precepts? Good son, these true precepts are where the *Eight Essentials* and the *Four Illuminations* converge as one. Your retinue should all contemplate this sutra, exploring its profundities. You should attentively uphold its subtle and intricate meanings. The single pure precept is the precept of nature, inherently and constantly pure. It can uphold what has been violated; once the mind confesses and reveals, purity is restored.

Next, you should observe: first, pure faith; second, pure mind; third, pure body. Awakening the supreme Way, body and mind become pure. This is the beginning of clarity and conduct, the origin of all practices. Because of this purity, great compassion arises, and all practices are undertaken. The Dharma of the Way is seen clearly, without obstruction. Through true understanding, the subtle origin is penetrated, and true principle is realized. Realm and wisdom are without discrepancy—this is called the Way. Why is this so? Because the true Way is realized. The Way responds with transformed bodies, and one should receive the teaching master.

Good son, those who uphold the true teaching and cultivate the true practice are called supreme and foremost guides, universally enabling beings to mature and understand the marks of the Way. Through various aspirations and vows, they lead all beings to seek the true and spontaneous fruition of the Way, inspiring all future beings to delight in propagating the supreme Way. They expound the treasury of wisdom of the One Vehicle’s sea-like emptiness, enabling all beings to awaken to equal benefit—rare indeed, rare indeed! Abiding in merit, they strengthen their own bodies, departing from the five dusts, relinquishing attachment and clinging, guarding their faculties, and dwelling in the unshakable realm of the supreme heavens’ constant bliss.

Good son, if there is one who relinquishes attachment and clinging, guarding the six senses and preventing evil, this person will dwell in the four fruits of mindfulness. Through mindfulness, they will thoroughly understand the profound and wondrous Dharma, without doubt or slander. Their mind will be like a lotus, radiant amidst the dust, unstained by defilements, free from thoughts of attachment and love. If one contemplates this form as empty and without substance, like a magically born prince of the great king, all virtues are pure. Born in the land of the Way, they can subdue others with the power of their virtue, seeking the Dharma and leaving the household life. Body and mind are pure, departing from the city of afflictions, ascending to the upper realms, personally attending the Divine Worthy. They deeply understand that all dharmas are empty, pure, neither existent nor non-existent, neither pure nor impure.

Why is this? Because all beings have not yet attained the understanding of emptiness. Due to the twofold contemplation of existence, they have not yet attained the subtle and profound power of samādhi and wisdom.

Good son, now that your retinue has left the household life, if you develop attachment to the profound and wondrous Dharma you have attained, because of this attachment, you will not attain purity."

chunks.original_text: 所以者何？ 清净正法无所有处。 若执诸法有他异相，则起爱着。 善男子，无有是处。 是爱着者无明想行，作意名行，行即是业。 真人童子正修六行，观於生死，未能舍离。 无量功德，由多修行，厌离诸恶； 有为生灭，起厌离诸恶； 有为生灭，起厌恶想。 此想如空，无有是处，不能久住。 一一诸法，皆有异义，未能了知。 一切众生言语不同，所因各异。 善男子，道以法门，摄法品类无量无边，或以五荫，以为法门，摄一切法。 众生根性，如在掌中。 钝根众生，不能深受。 真人童子以善法力，说此深法，令其能受无上正法。 说无量义，善巧方便，威德自在。 复以无量微妙正法，教於一切无量法门。 以是之故，无量无边。 名由句义，亦复无量无边。 微妙句义，以成众生无上巧言。 於不难法而生难想，立一切难，令彼受屈而不可答。 若有答言，令彼得解。 海空道果，以法为身。 云何法身？ 有多种义。 所说一切三世诸法，如有如无。 善男子，是方便门，是大慧门。 若有众生未有信者，以教一乘海空智藏，宝而持之。 未种善根，以爱慈之，坚固善根，普得成就，利益一切未成就者，令得成就； 未解脱者，令得解脱。 故以方便设於世间。 善男子，犹如大慧，增长功德，能利善力。 汝能善劝一切众生甚多甚多，勇猛精进，强求发愿，烦恼永灭，灭不复生。 善男子，光严智胜，汝亦希有，法地国王亦名希有，化生大王亦名希有。 和合善根，大慧众生，世间希有，海空智藏亦名希有，善种大王亦名希有。 於是天尊以大慈眼而说偈言： 方城法胜因，以法有种种。 故於天中天，无所有之法。 善哉微妙法，观色自性空。 大空及小空，俱是无所有。 本来非有法，众生妄想故。 如是於诸法，方城法胜因。 一切众生类，心分别所依。 如空无空有，无作亦无得。 不由如空空，是色空非色。 则生无分别，无色无空法。 故色即是空，若色与空异。 空体则不成，云何成不成？ 譬如有为法，与常相不异。 若能分别性，说此即是空。 空则是色空，云何色空空？ 色相无所有，则是有是空。 色空即是色，无有无分别。 此空即是色，空色空空空。 实性不可说，由如净土生。 非离色有空，故空不成色。 色体如虚空，故名为空空。 若空与色异，缘色不同真。 无有成圣义，空不能遣色。 无离凡夫义，若与分别相。 即生不净品，若与真实相。 即应成净品，故不可说空。 有色何为色，唯有名是色。 大哉善男子，若离名空色。 实无本性空，是自性无生。 无灭无深净，此色无所有。 有生即有染，故色无别相。 以无所有通，对假而立名。 是虚假所作，对诸名分别。 一切法本空，由假立容性。 随缘说诸法，如此一切名。 真人了不见，不见亦不生。 是名无等双，以此说为因。 无分亦无别，灭诸分别惑。 名与法不异，一切诸有法。 是色空非空，出则为种子。 入则无性生，有此无相理。 方地金刚眼，於名前无智。 多名及不定，成义由同体。 多杂体相异，以无相已有。 无染而有净，是故譬如空。 以是空法空，无自无他性。 真实性亦无，譬如镜中像。 所见无所有，善恶身业生。 色以影随形，如响相往来。 譬如光影响，由如水中月。 水中无所有，寂静心亦尔。 故说无有譬，由是无上道。
chunks.translated_text:
Why is this so? The pure and correct Dharma has no place of existence. If one clings to the notion that dharmas possess distinct characteristics, attachment arises. Good son, this is impossible. Such attachment is the activity of ignorance—what is called "volition" is action, and action is karma. The true person, the youth, rightly cultivates the six practices, contemplating birth and death, yet has not yet relinquished them. Through abundant cultivation, one grows weary of all evils; through conditioned arising and cessation, one generates aversion toward all evils. This perception, like emptiness, has no basis and cannot endure. Each and every dharma possesses distinct meanings, yet one has not fully understood them. All beings speak differently, their causes and conditions each unique.

Good son, the Dao, through its Dharma gates, encompasses immeasurable and boundless categories of dharmas. Some take the five aggregates as a Dharma gate to embrace all dharmas. The faculties of beings are as if in the palm of one’s hand. Dull-rooted beings cannot deeply receive it. The true person, the youth, by the power of wholesome dharmas, expounds this profound teaching, enabling them to receive the supreme correct Dharma. He teaches immeasurable meanings with skillful means, wielding majestic and sovereign virtue. Again, with immeasurable and subtle correct Dharmas, he instructs in all the boundless Dharma gates. For this reason, they are immeasurable and infinite. Names, phrases, and meanings are likewise immeasurable and infinite. Subtle phrases and meanings perfect beings’ supreme eloquence. Regarding what is not difficult, they conceive difficulty, establishing all manner of challenges to confound others, leaving them unable to respond. If one answers, it enables them to attain understanding.

The ocean of emptiness, the Dao, and its fruition take the Dharma as their body. What is the Dharma-body? It has many meanings. All dharmas of the three times, whether existent or non-existent—good son, this is the gate of skillful means, the gate of great wisdom. If there are beings who lack faith, teach them the One Vehicle, the ocean of emptiness, the treasury of wisdom, cherishing and upholding it. For those who have not planted wholesome roots, nurture them with loving-kindness, strengthening their wholesome roots so all may attain accomplishment, benefiting all who have not yet accomplished, enabling them to accomplish; those not yet liberated, enabling them to attain liberation. Thus, skillful means are established in the world.

Good son, just as great wisdom augments virtue and enhances wholesome power, you have skillfully exhorted countless beings, urging them to vigorous diligence, resolutely arousing the aspiration to forever extinguish afflictions, never to arise again. Good son, Radiant Wisdom Victorious, you are rare indeed; the Dharma Realm King is also rare; the Transformation-Born Great King is also rare. Harmonious wholesome roots, beings of great wisdom—rare in the world; the Ocean of Emptiness Wisdom Treasury is also rare; the Wholesome Seed Great King is also rare.

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy, with the eye of great compassion, spoke these verses:

The victorious cause of the Dharma citadel
Arises from the Dharma’s manifold nature.
Thus, among the Heaven of Heavens,
There is no Dharma of existence.

Excellent is the subtle and wondrous Dharma,
Contemplating the emptiness of form’s inherent nature.
Great emptiness and small emptiness—
Both are without existence.

Originally, there is no existent Dharma,
Yet beings, through deluded thought, conceive it so.
Thus, regarding all dharmas,
The victorious cause of the Dharma citadel:

All classes of beings
Depend on the mind’s discriminations.
Like emptiness, neither empty nor existent,
Without action, without attainment.

Not by "emptiness as emptiness,"
Is form’s emptiness non-form.
Then arises non-discrimination,
No form, no empty Dharma.

Thus, form is precisely emptiness;
If form and emptiness were distinct,
The essence of emptiness would not hold—
How could it be established or not?

For example, conditioned dharmas
Do not differ from the eternal.
If one discerns their nature,
This is called emptiness.

Emptiness is then form’s emptiness—
How can form’s emptiness be empty?
Form’s characteristics are without existence,
Yet this is both existence and emptiness.

Form’s emptiness is precisely form,
Without any non-discrimination.
This emptiness is precisely form,
Emptiness, form, emptiness, emptiness, emptiness.

True nature cannot be spoken,
As if born from a pure land.
Not apart from form is emptiness,
Thus emptiness does not become form.

Form’s essence is like empty space,
Hence named "emptiness of emptiness."
If emptiness and form were distinct,
Conditioned form would differ from truth.

There would be no meaning in sagehood,
Emptiness could not dispel form.
No meaning in leaving the ordinary,
If bound to discriminative appearances.

Then arises the impure,
If bound to true reality,
It should become pure—
Thus, emptiness cannot be spoken.

What makes form "form"?
Only the name is form.
Great indeed, good son,
If apart from name, empty form.

Truly, there is no inherent emptiness,
This is self-nature’s non-arising.
No cessation, no profound purity,
This form is without existence.

With arising comes defilement—
Thus, form has no separate characteristic.
Through "without existence," it pervades,
Opposed to the provisional to establish names.

This is the work of the illusory,
Opposed to all named discriminations.
All dharmas are fundamentally empty,
Provisionally establishing appearances.

According to conditions, dharmas are expounded—
Thus, all names are like this.
The true person sees nothing,
Not seeing, nor does it arise.

This is called the peerless pair,
By this, it is spoken as the cause.
Without division, without distinction,
Extinguishing all discriminative delusions.

Name and Dharma are not distinct,
All existent dharmas—
Form’s emptiness is not empty,
Emerging as the seed.

Entering, it is without-nature arising,
Possessing this signless principle.
The Vajra Eye of the Dharma Realm
Has no wisdom prior to names.

Many names and indeterminacy
Fulfill meaning through shared essence.
Many mixed, distinct characteristics—
Through signlessness, already existent.

Without defilement yet with purity,
Thus, it is like empty space.
Through this emptiness, the Dharma is empty,
Without self-nature or other-nature.

True reality is also absent,
Like an image in a mirror.
What is seen is without existence,
Yet wholesome and unwholesome bodily karma arises.

Form follows shadow like shape,
Like echoes coming and going.
Like light and reflections,
Like the moon in water.

The water holds nothing,
The tranquil mind is likewise.
Thus, no analogy exists—
This is the supreme Dao.

chunks.original_text: 善巧於世间，善哉大圣师。 分别说深隐，得悟一乘人。 尔时，大慧得闻天尊说此偈已，即问方城胜因童子：大哀天尊慈悲法雨，说此句义及说法处。 善哉，方城胜因童子，大慈天尊云何义故作如是言？ 天尊处处，经历诸天，云何不见生死？ 过去依他性中依真实性，生死来往，无差别义，辄欲谘问，未敢有言。 善哉，真人方城胜因，唯愿仁者与诸大王往诣尊所，请问疑惑，其意云何。 尔时，方城胜因童子答大慧言：善哉，法师。 我常思惟微妙正法，希愿弘持。 今汝赐问，唯在上仁。 於是善哉，相共驰往金光宝明信胜法王天尊座所，作礼恭敬，白天尊言：唯愿天尊哀愍答我。 尔时，大慧又复白言：一切众生，有缘无缘，从何而来； 有常无常，从何而来？ 空有之相，离常非常，文理相离，不见色有为有色耶，为无色耶？ 尔时，天尊欢喜答言：善哉善哉，善男子，汝今所问，实无所问； 汝今所说，实无所说。 汝今谛听，依位而坐。 我当告子本昔因缘。 善男子，於无常处说非常法，说非无常，非常、非非常，依无相义演说常道，是名无常。 善男子，依他性相，由真实性； 分数常住，由分别性。 故性亦无常。 由二性分，非常、非无常，如是义说常、无常无二，苦、乐无二，善、恶无二，空、不空无二，我、无我无二， 净、不净无二，性、不性无二，生、不生无二，灭、不灭无二。 何以故？ 由於是等差别见故，见常无常，见乐不乐，见净不净，见空不空，见性不性，见苦不苦，见灭不灭。 以是见故，和同一见； 以一见故，见无所见，亦无无见。 无见之见，随於众生。 说常无常，决了二性，寂灭来去。 尔时，天尊而说偈言： 桥梁善男子，大慧无上师。 诸法实希有，如彼种种现。 众圣之所尊，由此法非法。 无此法非法，无上善男子。 是义无为法，故说无二义。 依一分说言，或有或非有； 於二故说言，非有非非有。 显现故不无，是故无说常； 显现实相故，是故说非无。 由自体非有，自体不住故。 常取不有法，三性成无住。 田无性故成，前为后依止。 无生灭本净，及自性灭度。 一心如青莲，愿得真金花。 无为七宝光，常住法王所。 不入退法轮，愿生难胜地。 永保无为生，皆成无上道。 尔时，方城胜因童子得闻天尊说此偈已，谓大慧言：大哀天尊以大慈悲，成就一乘海空智藏无量义味，假於言说，令悟众生。 我今思惟，希有希有。 天尊善能说诸法相，非有非非有，非无非非无，非说非非说，因缘和合，开方便门，示导众生。 以是因缘，不可思议。 至道虚无，无所得故。 譬如揳用，用声止声。 何以故？ 譬如为病，因病服药，调养身心，病瘥药消，空无所有。 尔时，大慧复谓言曰：大慈天尊说诸法相，不空不有，不常不灭。 今我等辈知空有耶，不知之耶？ 譬如有人执平等法，演说彼此，空无有处。 天尊亦尔，平等法身，安置心中，故说如是。 譬如有人，说昔是今。 天尊成就，平等为意。 譬如有人，有一金钱，以此金钱营觅得千，非不得千，非非一得。 天尊亦尔，如一金钱得千万钱。 如是之相，譬如有人诵持经典，所得功德，百千万劫。 以是一切功德千万，亦复如是。 得一金钱，用千万钱，亦复如是。 若有男女求道亦尔，能行小善而有胜报，由谁发愿，於安乐道，国土清 净，往诣受生，具十想念，成就其心。
chunks.translated_text:
Skilled in worldly affairs,
Excellent, great sagely master.
Distinguishing and expounding the profound and hidden,
Those who awaken to the One Vehicle attain realization.

At that time, having heard the Celestial Worthy recite this verse, Great Wisdom questioned the Youth of Victorious Causes of the Jeweled Citadel: "By the great compassion of the Celestial Worthy, the rain of Dharma has poured forth these words and the place of their teaching. Excellent, Youth of Victorious Causes of the Jeweled Citadel, for what meaning did the Celestial Worthy of Great Compassion speak thus? Though the Celestial Worthy traverses all heavens in every place, how does he not perceive birth and death? In the past, within *paratantra*-nature, dependent upon true reality, the coming and going of birth and death held no distinction in meaning. I wished to inquire but dared not speak. Excellent, Perfected One, Youth of Victorious Causes of the Jeweled Citadel, I only hope that you and the great kings will proceed to the Worthy One’s abode to request the resolution of these doubts. What is the intent?"

At that time, the Youth of Victorious Causes of the Jeweled Citadel replied to Great Wisdom: "Excellent, Dharma Master. I constantly contemplate the subtle and wondrous true Dharma, aspiring to propagate and uphold it. Now that you have deigned to ask, it is most fitting for one of your virtue." Thereupon, excellent indeed, they hastened together to the seat of the Celestial Worthy, King of the Dharma of Radiant Golden Light and Supreme Faith. Making obeisance and paying reverence, they addressed the Celestial Worthy: "We only hope the Celestial Worthy will take pity and answer us."

At that time, Great Wisdom further addressed the Celestial Worthy: "All sentient beings, whether with karmic conditions or without, from whence do they come? Whether eternal or impermanent, from whence do they come? The characteristics of emptiness and existence—apart from eternal and non-eternal, do the principles of scripture and reason separate? Is what is seen as form considered conditioned and possessing form, or is it formless? At that time, the Celestial Worthy joyfully replied: "Excellent, excellent, good man. What you now ask is truly no question at all; what you now speak is truly nothing spoken. Now listen carefully and sit according to your station. I shall tell you of the original causes and conditions of the past. Good man, where the impermanent is spoken of as non-impermanent, and where non-impermanent is spoken of as neither impermanent nor non-impermanent, relying on the meaning of signlessness to expound the eternal Dao—this is called the impermanent. Good man, the characteristics of *paratantra*-nature arise from true reality; the partial abiding arises from the nature of discrimination. Thus, nature is also impermanent. From the division of these two natures, neither impermanent nor non-impermanent, the meaning of eternal and impermanent is spoken as non-dual, suffering and joy as non-dual, good and evil as non-dual, empty and non-empty as non-dual, self and no-self as non-dual, pure and impure as non-dual, nature and non-nature as non-dual, arising and non-arising as non-dual, cessation and non-cessation as non-dual. Why is this so? Because through these distinctions of perception, one sees the eternal and non-eternal, sees joy and non-joy, sees purity and impurity, sees emptiness and non-emptiness, sees nature and non-nature, sees suffering and non-suffering, sees cessation and non-cessation. Because of this perception, all views harmonize into one; because of this one view, what is seen is no seeing, nor is there non-seeing. The seeing of no-seeing follows sentient beings. Speaking of eternal and non-eternal, decisively understanding the two natures, the coming and going of quiescence and extinction."

At that time, the Celestial Worthy recited a verse:

"Bridge-like, good man,
Great Wisdom, supreme master.
The true rarity of all dharmas
Is like their manifold appearances.
Revered by all sages,
Through this Dharma and non-Dharma.
Without this Dharma and non-Dharma,
Supreme good man.
This is the unconditioned Dharma,
Thus the non-dual meaning is spoken.
Depending on one aspect, it is said
To be existent or non-existent;
Depending on two, it is said
To be neither existent nor non-existent.
Because it manifests, it is not non-existent,
Thus it is not spoken of as eternal;
Because it reveals true reality,
Thus it is spoken of as not non-existent.
By its own nature being non-existent,
Its own nature not abiding.
Constantly grasping the non-existent Dharma,
The three natures attain non-abiding.
Fields, being without nature, become
The prior support for the posterior.
Without arising or cessation, originally pure,
And self-nature entering extinction.
One mind like the blue lotus,
May it attain the true golden flower.
The unconditioned light of the seven treasures,
Abiding in the realm of the Dharma King.
Not entering the wheel of retrogression,
May it be born in the Ground of Difficult Victory.
Forever preserving the unconditioned arising,
All accomplish the supreme Dao."

At that time, having heard the Celestial Worthy recite this verse, the Youth of Victorious Causes of the Jeweled Citadel said to Great Wisdom: "By the great compassion of the Celestial Worthy, the treasury of ocean-like, empty wisdom of the One Vehicle, with its boundless flavors of meaning, is provisionally expressed through words to awaken sentient beings. I now contemplate this—rare indeed, rare indeed! The Celestial Worthy skillfully expounds the characteristics of all dharmas as neither existent nor non-existent, neither non-existent nor non-non-existent, neither spoken nor non-spoken. Through the harmonious convergence of causes and conditions, he opens the gate of expedient means to guide and instruct sentient beings. For this reason, it is inconceivable. The ultimate Dao is empty and without attainment. It is like using a wedge to remove a wedge. Why is this so? It is like treating an illness: because of the illness, medicine is taken to regulate body and mind. When the illness is cured, the medicine is dissolved, leaving nothing behind."

At that time, Great Wisdom further addressed him: "The Celestial Worthy of Great Compassion expounds the characteristics of all dharmas as neither empty nor existent, neither eternal nor extinct. Now, do we know emptiness and existence, or do we not know them? It is like someone who grasps the Dharma of equality, expounding this and that, where emptiness has no place. The Celestial Worthy is also thus—his Dharma-body of equality is established in the mind, thus he speaks in this way. It is like someone saying that the past is the present. The Celestial Worthy’s accomplishment is equality of intent. It is like someone possessing one gold coin, with which they seek to obtain a thousand. It is not that they do not obtain a thousand, nor is it that one does not obtain. The Celestial Worthy is also thus—like obtaining a thousand or ten thousand coins from one gold coin. Such is the characteristic: it is like someone reciting and upholding sutras, whose merit accrues over hundreds of thousands of kalpas. All such merits of a thousand or ten thousand are likewise thus. Obtaining one gold coin and using a thousand or ten thousand is also thus. If there are men and women seeking the Dao who are also thus, able to practice small virtues yet receiving superior reward—by whose vow do they, on the path of bliss, in a pure land, proceed to be reborn, possessing the ten reflections and accomplishing their minds?"

chunks.original_text: 若有众生，成就天尊，先为赞叹，布施功德。 若其有人，或为财宝，毁此财宝，有悭吝心，不依道惠，设善方便，令诸一切万物众生不违道教，亦复如是。 尔时，方城胜因童子而於尊前作礼，叉手说偈颂曰： 天尊大哀母，善说无上义，言熏习所生。 一切有诸法，如是果报成，若人若非人，受道自然生。 故说梵尊师，疾成海空兵。 从有相有见，应知法入明。 依他中分别，非无真实情。 故不得此药，我法普等平。 奉道住功德，善有众义荣，俱发智慧道，咸登太上京。 尔时，方城胜因童子说此偈已，谓海空言：大哉真士，因缘久远，身有光明，自在神通，出於世间，德行圆满，不可叹说。 众生染溺，以何根性作如是难？ 入以不入，出以不出，爱着两边，其事云何？ 尔时，海空智藏答胜因言：大士仁者，入无有二，见法平等，非一非非一，以兹诸法，无有是处。 何以故？ 破诸魔邪，降伏一切邪心外道，於是功德世间无有，天魔外道说於正理。 天尊所说，微妙正法，安立自法，亦无有定。 何以故？ 大哀天尊所说本性无上正道，所说正法，不可转变，不可破坏。 何以故？ 智慧圆满，一切天魔、异见、外道，邪心执着，障於大法，起见有心，破於大法。
chunks.translated_text:
If there are sentient beings who accomplish the Celestial Worthy, first extolling and praising the merit of almsgiving—should there be those who, whether for wealth or treasure, damage this wealth and treasure, harboring a miserly heart, not following the Dao’s grace, yet devise skillful means to ensure all myriad beings do not transgress the Dao’s teachings—it is likewise thus.

At that time, the youth *Victorious Cause of the Square City* bowed before the Worthy, joined his palms, and spoke these verses:

The Celestial Worthy, great compassionate mother,
Well expounds the supreme meaning,
Whose words, through cultivation, give rise.
All dharmas that exist,
Thus fruition is perfected.
Whether human or non-human,
Receiving the Dao, they naturally arise.
Thus it is said: the revered Brahmā master
Swiftly completes the *Ocean of Emptiness* host.
From form and views,
One should know the dharma enters illumination.
Dependent arising’s middle discrimination
Is not without true reality.
Thus, not obtaining this medicine,
My Dharma is universally equal and level.
Upholding the Dao, abiding in merit,
Goodness flourishes with manifold meanings.
Together, we set forth on the path of wisdom,
All ascending to the Supreme Capital.

When the youth *Victorious Cause of the Square City* had finished these verses, he addressed *Ocean of Emptiness*: "Great indeed is the true being! Through causes and conditions of distant antiquity, your body radiates light, your spiritual penetrations are sovereign, you emerge into the world, your virtue and conduct are perfectly fulfilled—such cannot be praised enough. Sentient beings, sunk in defilement, by what root-nature do they pose such difficulties? Entering yet not entering, departing yet not departing, clinging to both extremes—how does this occur?"

At that time, *Ocean of Emptiness Treasury of Wisdom* replied to *Victorious Cause*: "Great being, benevolent one, entering is without duality. Seeing the Dharma as equal, it is neither one nor not-one. By these dharmas, there is no such place. Why? Shattering all demonic perversities, subduing all heretical minds and external paths, such merit is unmatched in the world. Heavenly demons and external paths speak of true principle, yet the Celestial Worthy’s teachings—subtle and wondrous true Dharma—establish their own Dharma, which also has no fixed nature. Why? The Celestial Worthy of Great Compassion teaches the supreme true Dao of original nature, the true Dharma taught cannot be altered or destroyed. Why? With wisdom perfectly fulfilled, all heavenly demons, heterodox views, external paths, and perverse minds clinging to attachments obstruct the great Dharma, giving rise to views of existence and destroying the great Dharma."
chunks.overlap_context: one reciting and upholding sutras, whose merit accrues over hundreds of thousands of kalpas. All such merits of a thousand or ten thousand are likewise thus. Obtaining one gold coin and using a thousand or ten thousand is also thus. If there are men and women seeking the Dao who are also thus, able to practice small virtues yet receiving superior reward—by whose vow do they, on the path of bliss, in a pure land, proceed to be reborn, possessing the ten reflections and accomplishing their minds?"

chunks.original_text: 以是因缘，盛光童子现种种身，而为说法，度脱众生，显现功德，谓以无我故，显现清 净微妙功德。 我无有量方便功德，如世间法，上界为胜。 善男子，我说法教，谓穷生死。 能生一切众生善根，利益安乐，无碍功德。 大哀天尊住以法界，无为胜法。 善男子，法界有二：一者染界，二者无染界。 无染界者，清 净最胜。 何以故？ 大哀天尊穷生死际，利益安乐，功乐无尽。 尔时，海空而说偈言： 能持大爱法，随顺於善根。 非自亦非他，有益有增损。 天尊於何处，说此诸法相？ 此界无始时，一切法依止。 若有诸道上，及有得灭度，如是本非本，希有亦希有。 尔时，海空说此偈已，复问方城胜因童子：说言道士、一切众生初不了达，无明为尽，贪爱所缚，或随流接，有时畜生，有时鬼道，有时人道，有时天尊，有时天真。 诸道士等，虽得出家，颠倒邪见，不觉不知，於世间中如是受苦，增长贪爱，恒受罪谪。 是诸道士何因缘故，不觉不知？ 尔时，胜因童子答海空言：善哉真士，是诸道士虽得出家，爱诸执着，奸诈炽盛，多畜奸盗，而言出家，希求名利，欲入供养。 善男子，如是因缘，恒受罪谪。 何以故？ 出家在家。 善男子，如是之人，恒受罪谪。 天尊说言，作如是意。 善男子，有德道士无所爱着，求於胜法，观一切法无常境界，空无所有。 如是出家，与善因缘。 善恶因缘，各随所趣，不关他人。 善男子，天尊说言，此识诫者依持是处，恒不舍离，无有是我。 何以故？ 空空法故。
chunks.translated_text:
Through this cause and condition, the Radiant Light Youth manifests in various forms to expound the Dharma, liberating sentient beings and revealing his virtues—namely, by virtue of non-self, he displays pure and subtle merits. My boundless expedient virtues, like worldly dharmas, deem the higher realms as superior.

Good man, the teachings I expound exhaust the cycle of birth and death. They generate all wholesome roots in sentient beings, benefiting and bringing peace, with unimpeded merit. The Celestial Worthy of Great Compassion abides in the Dharma-realm, the supreme unconditioned Dharma.

Good man, the Dharma-realm has two aspects: first, the defiled realm; second, the undefiled realm. The undefiled realm is the purest and most supreme. Why? The Celestial Worthy of Great Compassion exhausts the limits of birth and death, benefiting and bringing peace, with boundless merit and bliss.

At that time, Oceanic Emptiness spoke in verse:

Who upholds the Dharma of great love,
Accords with wholesome roots.
Neither self nor other,
Yet brings benefit, growth, or decline.

Where does the Celestial Worthy
Expound these dharma marks?
This realm, without beginning,
Is the support of all dharmas.

If there are those on the Way
Who attain liberation,
Such original or non-original states—
Rare indeed, rare indeed.

When Oceanic Emptiness had finished speaking these verses, he further asked the Victorious Cause Youth: "You speak of Daoists and all sentient beings who initially do not comprehend, their ignorance unexhausted, bound by craving and attachment. Some drift along, now reborn as animals, now as hungry ghosts, now as humans, now as Celestial Worthies, now as Perfected Ones. Though these Daoists have left the household life, they hold inverted and perverse views, unaware and unknowing. In the world, they thus endure suffering, increasing their craving and attachment, constantly subject to karmic retribution. For what cause and condition do these Daoists remain unaware and unknowing?"

At that time, the Victorious Cause Youth replied to Oceanic Emptiness: "Excellent, true man! Though these Daoists have left the household life, they cling to attachments, their deceit and cunning ablaze. They accumulate much fraud and theft, yet claim to have left the household life, seeking fame and profit, desiring offerings.

Good man, through such causes and conditions, they constantly endure karmic retribution. Why? Whether leaving the household or remaining in it—good man, such persons constantly endure karmic retribution. The Celestial Worthy has declared this intent.

Good man, virtuous Daoists have no attachments. They seek the supreme Dharma, contemplating all dharmas as impermanent, empty, and without possession. Such leaving of the household accords with wholesome causes and conditions. Wholesome and unwholesome causes and conditions each follow their own course, unrelated to others.

Good man, the Celestial Worthy has declared: Those who uphold this admonition rely on this place, constantly without forsaking it, without any notion of self. Why? Because of the emptiness of emptiness."

With wisdom perfectly fulfilled, all heavenly demons, heterodox views, external paths, and perverse minds clinging to attachments obstruct the great Dharma, giving rise to views of existence and destroying the great Dharma."

chunks.original_text: 恒河上沙，诸是功德，亦无有着。 善男子，若真人藏，有了不了，无有处处。 大哀天尊秘密宝藏，非非有无，亦非有无，无有是处。 善出家者，依止是处。 非出家人，着识多行，奸诈妄语，归恶趣门，自着自缚，不问外集，苦哉叹言。 一切众生，皆悉如是。 胜因童子语大真士海空智藏作如是事，答曰：不也。 真士大师因缘广远，今日欣勇，无上大师，无量眷属。 汝能发念无上道心，不可思议。 尔时，胜因童子於大众中仍说偈曰： 诸法依藏住，一切众生识。 故名可利耶，我为人演说。 执持识深细，法种子恒流。 於凡我不说，彼勿执为我。 如非一切行，一切行不知。 真人於善识，则离除五识。 若对治转依，非灭故不成。 果因无差别，於灭则有遇。 无种子无法，若许为转依。 於无二无故，转依义不成。 无余心转法，以何方便作，而到海空藏。 太上一乘海空智藏经卷之四竟 太上一乘海空智藏经卷五
chunks.translated_text:
The grains of sand upon the Ganges—all such merits too are without attachment.

Good man, if the treasury of the true person holds what is realized and what is not, there is no place for it anywhere. The Celestial Worthy of Great Compassion’s secret and precious treasury is neither non-being nor non-non-being, neither being nor non-being, and has no such locus.

Those who leave the household in truth rely and abide in this locus. Those who are not true renunciates cling to consciousness, engaging in many deeds, deceit, and false speech. They return to the gates of evil destinies, binding themselves, heedless of external gatherings, and cry out in lament: “Alas, suffering!”

All sentient beings are just like this.

The youth of supreme causes addressed the great perfected one, Ocean-void Wisdom-treasury, saying: “Is it thus?” He replied: “It is not.”

The true person, the great master, has causes and conditions vast and far-reaching. Today, with joyful courage, the supreme great master and his immeasurable retinue—you have aroused the mind set upon the supreme Dao, which is inconceivable.

At that time, the youth of supreme causes, amidst the great assembly, further spoke these verses:

All dharmas abide dependent on the treasury,
All sentient beings’ consciousness.
Thus it is called *kalya*—
I expound it for others.

Grasping and holding to subtle consciousness,
The seeds of dharmas flow constantly.
To the ordinary and to the “I,” I do not speak;
Let them not cling to it as “I.”

As not all activities,
All activities do not know.
The true person, in accord with wholesome consciousness,
Then departs from the five consciousnesses.

If counteracting and transforming reliance,
It does not become extinguished, thus it is not accomplished.
Cause and fruit are not distinct;
In extinction, there is encounter.

Without seeds, without dharma—
If one allows this to be transformation of reliance,
Since there is no duality and no “there is,”
The meaning of transformation of reliance does not arise.

Without residue, mind transforms dharma—
By what expedient means
Does one arrive at Ocean-void Wisdom-treasury?

Thus concludes *Scroll the Fourth of the Supreme One Vehicle’s Ocean-void Wisdom-treasury Sutra*.
*Scroll the Fifth of the Supreme One Vehicle’s Ocean-void Wisdom-treasury Sutra* begins.

chunks.original_text: 问病品 尔时，海空智藏即起於座，安心正礼，白天尊言：天尊今者离众恼病，患苦无常，无复生死，常乐清净，微妙具足。 大慈天尊，云何众生有四种病？ 云何四种贪爱声色、愚痴憍慢，是诸病因？ 使心狂醒，迷闷乱动，则有病生。 何以故？ 贪发身病，爱发心病，身心等病，四百四病，皮肤损瘦，心情驰闷，五脏殊乖，小便淋沥，眼耳疼痛，腹痛背病，四肢百节、习习疼痛，如是种种身心诸病。 大哀天尊无复有病。 是故我今见诸众生，若人非人，悉皆有病。 如是等病，我今亦病，腹病心病。 唯愿天尊哀愍我等，说诸医药，疗治当来一切众生，未见者见，未闻者闻。 尔时，天尊赞海空言：善哉善哉，善男子，汝善知时，为众谘请，怜愍众生，故作斯病。 欲遣病者，请我医治。 善男子，汝等已於无量劫中修行大慈，常以爱念，利益众生，不令苦恼。 施诸病者，种种医乐。 云何於今自言有病？ 善男子，为见世人腹病心病，及皮肤损瘦，便大忧苦。 为治诸恶，新学道士贪畜一切不 净之物。 汝实无病，欲令一切愚痴众生而共回向一乘海空智慧宝藏，为除众生诸烦恼障、贪欲、瞋恚、愚痴、忿怒。 善男子，真人童子修行大慈，施给一切病者医药，常作念言，愿诸众生永断诸病，得成真实金刚之身； 复愿一切无量众生恒值妙药，断除一切聋盲恶病。 以断病故，得智慧药； 以得药力，断除一切诸恶毒恼。 是诸众生於智慧药，生不退转，速得成就无上道药，消除一切重见烦恼，勤行精进，成就天尊智慧之心。 作平等药，普治众病，勿令众人生诽谤想。 以平等药，药根药树，药茎药叶，是平等药，疗治一切诸恶重病，诸恶重见，诸恶重恼，诸恶重心，复愿众生出烦恼城，离於爱狱，成就天尊 净明光智，入於海空秘密宝藏。 善男子，真人童子已於无量十方世界国土发弘誓愿，愿诸众生离诸病根，病树病枝。 是诸病病，空净清凉，常乐自在，微妙具足，等无等相。 尔时，海空白天尊言：云何我病而言无病？ 我今思惟，世间有病，不能坐起，俯仰嵬嵬，食不通进，浆不下入，口不能言。 如失教儿子，修治家业，於时宗亲、父母、妻子、兄弟、知识各各周竟，生必死想。 天尊，我今亦复如是。 我见众生住烦恼城，但见铁丸炎炎彤彤，饿鬼仰天，哭声隆隆，饥则食炭，渴饮火精，狱吏牛头，目如明星，手持铁叉，绕镬汤中，手捉脚踏，内於镬中，身骨糜散。 以是因缘，我见生病，腹病、心病。 云何天尊说言无病？ 尔时，海空说是语已，即於尊前作偈，请曰： 大慈大德尊，三界仰希有。 愿为演平等，智慧药树根。 我今诸病子，朝夕保难存，腹病心转侧，神气甚昏昏。 下愚凡夫见，岂识良药门？ 如盲不见道，进尺不知寸。 虽有四衢路，随意任驰奔。 三世慈悲父，常说智藏门。 烦恼四病起，身散神魄魂，冥冥地狱下，焉能见子孙？ 日生日复死，永别长乐尊。 吾愍诸众生，启请平等药。 若人若非人，服者得长存。 喻如甘露雨，柯叶悉沾恩。 萌花根枝树，果熟随人吞。 唯愿太上尊，演说一乘道。 是诸冥冥苦，睹见失迷怨。 故哀当来众，顶礼忘魄魂。 但见饿鬼子，三涂觅子孙； 牛头曳入镬，狱卒铁叉翻， 哭声如雷霆，骨聚成昆仑；
chunks.translated_text:
**Chapter on Inquiring About Illness**

At that time, Ocean-void Wisdom-treasury rose from his seat, composed his mind, and bowed in reverence, addressing the Heavenly Venerable: "Heavenly Venerable, now free from all afflictions and ailments, beyond the suffering of impermanence, no longer subject to birth and death, you abide in constant bliss, purity, subtlety, and perfection. Greatly Compassionate Heavenly Venerable, why do sentient beings suffer from four kinds of illness? How do the four defilements—craving for sounds and forms, ignorance, arrogance, and pride—become the causes of these diseases? They drive the mind to madness, confusion, and agitation, giving rise to illness. Why is this so? Greed breeds bodily disease; attachment breeds mental disease. When body and mind are equally afflicted, the four hundred and four diseases arise: the skin withers, the flesh wastes away, the heart races in distress, the five viscera fall into discord, urine drips incessantly, eyes and ears ache, the abdomen and back throb with pain, and the four limbs and hundred joints ache ceaselessly. Such are the manifold diseases of body and mind.

The Greatly Compassionate Heavenly Venerable is forever free from illness. Yet now I see all sentient beings—whether human or non-human—suffering from disease. These very illnesses afflict me as well: abdominal disease and heart disease. I beseech the Heavenly Venerable, in your mercy toward us, to expound the healing medicines that may cure all sentient beings of the future, allowing the unseen to see and the unheard to hear."

Then the Heavenly Venerable praised Ocean-void, saying: "Excellent, excellent, good man! You know the right time, inquiring for the sake of all, moved by compassion for sentient beings, and thus speak of illness. Desiring to dispel their suffering, you ask me to prescribe the cure. Good man, you have cultivated great compassion for immeasurable kalpas, ever cherishing and benefiting sentient beings, sparing them from distress. You have offered various medicines and joys to the afflicted. Why then do you now claim to be ill? Good man, it is because you see worldly people suffering from abdominal and heart diseases, their skin and flesh wasting away, that you grieve deeply. To cure these ills, newly ordained Daoists, in their greed, hoard all manner of impure things. In truth, you are not ill; you wish only to guide all deluded sentient beings toward the single vehicle of the Ocean-void Wisdom-treasury, removing their afflictions—greed, anger, ignorance, and wrath.

Good man, the true person, the youth who cultivates great compassion, provides medicine to all the sick, constantly vowing: *May all sentient beings forever sever their diseases and attain the true adamantine body; may all infinite beings always encounter wondrous medicines, cutting off all deafness, blindness, and malignant illnesses.* By severing disease, they gain the medicine of wisdom; by the power of this medicine, they eradicate all venomous afflictions. These sentient beings, in the medicine of wisdom, attain non-retrogression and swiftly accomplish the supreme medicine of the Dao, dissolving all heavy views and afflictions. Diligent in practice, they perfect the wisdom-heart of the Heavenly Venerable. They concoct the medicine of equality, universally curing all diseases, preventing sentient beings from harboring slanderous thoughts. With the medicine of equality—its roots, trunks, branches, and leaves—this medicine of equality heals all grave illnesses, grave views, grave afflictions, and grave hearts. May all beings escape the city of afflictions, depart from the prison of craving, and accomplish the Heavenly Venerable’s pure, luminous, radiant wisdom, entering the secret treasury of Ocean-void.

Good man, the true person, the youth, has already made vast vows across the infinite worlds and lands of the ten directions: *May all sentient beings be freed from the roots, trunks, and branches of disease.* These diseases, empty, pure, cool, and blissful, are ever at ease, subtle, and perfect, equal and beyond equality in aspect."

Then Ocean-void addressed the Heavenly Venerable: "How can you say I am not ill when I am? Now I reflect: in this world, the sick cannot sit or rise, their movements labored, food and drink obstructed, their mouths unable to speak. Like a lost son managing the family estate, when the time comes, kin—parents, spouse, siblings, and friends—each scatter, knowing birth must end in death. Heavenly Venerable, I am just the same. I see sentient beings dwelling in the city of afflictions, beholding only iron pellets glowing red-hot, hungry ghosts wailing skyward, their cries thunderous, eating embers when hungry, drinking fiery essence when thirsty. Hell’s wardens, ox-headed, eyes like bright stars, wield iron forks, circling cauldrons of boiling water. They seize the damned by hand and foot, casting them in, their bones and flesh dissolving. For these reasons, I see myself as ill—abdominal disease, heart disease. How can you say I am not?"

Having spoken thus, Ocean-void composed a verse before the Venerable, entreating:

Greatly Compassionate, Greatly Virtuous One,
Rare in the Three Realms, all look to you.
I pray you expound the equal,
The root of the wisdom-medicine tree.

Now I, a child of many diseases,
From dawn to dusk, barely endure.
My abdomen aches, my heart writhes,
My spirit dims, my breath grows faint.

The lowly, foolish common folk—
How could they know the gate of good medicine?
Like the blind who cannot see the path,
Advancing a foot, they know not an inch.

Though four roads lie before them,
They gallop as they please.
Father of compassion through the three times,
You ever teach the gate of the wisdom-treasury.

When the four diseases of affliction arise,
Body scatters, spirit and soul disperse.
In the dark depths of hell,
How can they see their children and grandchildren?

Day by day, they are born and die again,
Forever parted from the Blissful Venerable.
I pity all sentient beings,
And beg for the medicine of equality.

Whether human or non-human,
Whoever partakes shall endure.
Like sweet dew raining down,
Every branch and leaf receives its grace.

Sprouts, flowers, roots, and trees,
Fruit ripens for all to consume.
I only pray, O Heavenly Venerable,
Expound the single-vehicle Dao.

For those lost in the darkness of suffering,
Who see and yet remain deluded, resentful—
Pity the multitudes yet to come,
Who bow in reverence, forgetting body and soul.

They see only the children of hungry ghosts,
Seeking kin in the three wretched paths.
Ox-heads drag them into cauldrons,
Hell’s wardens flip them with iron forks.

Their wails shake like thunder,
Their bones pile like mountains.
"

chunks.original_text: 饥则食火炭，渴则饮火精。 唯垂大慈教，普出地狱门。 是诸众生等，稽首无上尊。 尔时，天尊大慈熏心，答海空言：善哉善哉，善男子，汝善知时，为众谘请。 是诸众生，各从念生种种分别，於分别中求种种色，求种种声，求种种香，求种种味，求种种触。 以是因缘，眼病、耳病、腹病、心病、身形等病，四百四病。 汝欲随顺一切众生，欲利益故，作偈谘请。 於是天尊正几而坐，头面熙怡，如红莲花； 容貌端严，如日月光。 於是天尊放大光明，徧照虚空。 是其光明，逾百千日，照於东南西北方、四维上下、一切诸国，他方世界，惠施众生，平等药炬，悉令得灭四百四病，令诸众生安住不退，得平等心。 尔时，天尊静处思惟，现微妙色，七十二相，八十一好，庄严其身。 尔时，身上一一相好，出一宝花，其花微妙，各具千叶，纯红莲花，瑠璃为茎，珊瑚为枝，琥珀为根，真珠为叶，形相挺特，犹如宝幢。 是诸宝花，复有种种杂色光明，青黄赤白红绿朱紫。 是诸光明，普皆徧照无明地狱、无间地狱、呼嗟地狱、号涕地狱、火车地狱、火床地狱、铁丸地狱、铁镬地狱。 尔时，狱中复有饿鬼，独形饿鬼、独体饿鬼、独骨饿鬼、独触饿鬼、枯形饿鬼、枯皮饿鬼、枯骨饿鬼、枯肉饿鬼、空食饿鬼、炭食饿鬼、无形饿鬼、涕哭饿鬼，如是等鬼，常受寒苦，逼恼无常，头面破裂，身体毁碎，更相残害。 是诸饿鬼，遇见光色，如是等苦，亦灭无余，即得调伏，和温臑适。 亦见光中海空宝台秘密之藏，说言众生、是诸饿鬼皆有道性。 尔时，饿鬼闻是语已，各各忏悔，即便命终，托生人天。 是诸地狱悉皆空虚，无受罪者。 唯有不信、诽谤一乘海空智藏，饥渴逼切，於此狱中百千余岁，未曾得闻甘露之名，未曾得闻甘雨之润。 当尔之时，地狱空虚。 尔时，光中，复有百千真仙、童子各各手把金莲玉花，一一莲花皆有道士，庄严最上，世之无比。 尔时，花中真形道士、真相道士、真惠道士、法喜道士、法成道士、法解道士、法泽道士、法真道士、法乐道士、妙严道士、妙心道士、妙见道士、妙苑道士、妙花道士、妙相道士， 尔时，道士，各共集会，或行或坐，或卧或住，各奏妙音，吹凤笙、琴、筝、筑、箜篌，凤凰、孔雀、狮子、白虎，啸歌邕邕，音声和雅。 是男是女，莫不寻声，得见地狱、畜生、饿鬼，若人非人，悉皆欢喜。 尔时，天尊为诸众生说一乘宝藏，或说三洞明科，或说丹书，成就三乘，利益一切。 或说出家，坐於空城，七宝庄严，转妙法轮。 转法轮已，是时国人、一切众生悉皆得益，盲者见色，聋者听声，痖者能言，跛者能行，贫者得富，贫富齐等，不信者信。 如是众生，无量无边，修行一乘海空之藏。 尔时，复有天龙鬼神、虚空龙鬼、猛马八威、羌胡氐老，若人非人，悉共同声，如是赞言：善哉善哉，无上天尊，多所利益。 说是语已，踊跃欢喜，或歌或舞，礼拜恭敬，围绕赞叹，烧香散花，幢盖伎乐，种种音声，微妙具足，振於座所。 供养天尊、大慈天尊，哀愍我等，生居边地，有人之形，不具种智。 云何海空乘七宝台，为诸众生说一乘智藏？ 如是希有，难见难闻。 云何说言我身亦病？
chunks.translated_text:
When hungry, they eat burning coals;
When thirsty, they drink flames of fire.
Only by Your great compassion’s teaching
May all escape the gates of hell.

These multitudes of sentient beings
Bow their heads to the Supreme Venerable.
Then, the Heavenly Venerable, his heart suffused with boundless mercy, answered Haikong, saying:
“Excellent, excellent, good man! You know well the time and have made this inquiry for the sake of all beings.
These sentient beings, each born from their own thoughts, give rise to manifold distinctions. Within these distinctions, they seek manifold forms, manifold sounds, manifold scents, manifold tastes, manifold touches.
From these causes and conditions arise diseases of the eye, ear, belly, heart, and body—four hundred and four afflictions in all.
You, wishing to accord with all sentient beings and to benefit them, have composed verses to make this inquiry.”

Thereupon, the Heavenly Venerable sat upright upon his throne, his countenance radiant and joyful as a red lotus, his majestic bearing luminous as the sun and moon.
Then the Heavenly Venerable emitted a great light, suffusing the empty sky. This radiance, surpassing that of a hundred thousand suns, illuminated the eastern, southern, western, and northern quarters, the four intermediate directions, the zenith and nadir, all lands, and other worlds, bestowing upon all beings the torch of the equality-medicine, extinguishing their four hundred and four afflictions, and establishing all sentient beings in unwavering steadfastness, granting them the mind of equality.

At that time, the Heavenly Venerable, in tranquil contemplation, manifested a wondrous form adorned with seventy-two marks and eighty-one excellences, his body resplendent.
From each mark and excellence upon his body bloomed a precious flower, exquisitely subtle, each with a thousand petals—a pure red lotus with a lapis lazuli stem, coral branches, amber roots, and pearl leaves, its form towering and majestic like a jeweled banner.
These precious flowers emitted manifold hues of light—azure, yellow, crimson, white, red, green, vermilion, and purple.
These lights universally illuminated the hells of ignorance, the uninterrupted hell, the wailing hell, the weeping hell, the hell of fire chariots, the hell of fire beds, the hell of iron pellets, and the hell of iron cauldrons.

At that time, within the hells were also hungry ghosts—lonely-form hungry ghosts, solitary-body hungry ghosts, solitary-bone hungry ghosts, solitary-touch hungry ghosts, withered-form hungry ghosts, withered-skin hungry ghosts, withered-bone hungry ghosts, withered-flesh hungry ghosts, empty-eating hungry ghosts, coal-eating hungry ghosts, formless hungry ghosts, and weeping hungry ghosts. Such ghosts constantly endured the suffering of cold, tormented by impermanence, their heads and faces shattered, their bodies broken and torn, mutually harming one another.
When these hungry ghosts beheld the light, all such sufferings vanished without trace, and they were immediately pacified, their bodies soothed and at ease.
They also saw within the light the secret treasury of Haikong’s jeweled terrace, where it was proclaimed that all sentient beings, even these hungry ghosts, possess the nature of the Dao.
Upon hearing these words, the hungry ghosts each repented, and at once their lives ended, and they were reborn among humans and gods. All the hells became utterly empty, with none left to suffer punishment.
Only those who disbelieved and slandered the single-vehicle treasury of Haikong’s wisdom remained, tormented by hunger and thirst, abiding in those hells for hundreds of thousands of years, never having heard the name of sweet dew, never having received the moisture of sweet rain.

At that time, the hells stood empty.
Then, within the light, appeared hundreds of thousands of perfected immortals and youths, each holding golden lotuses and jade flowers. Within each lotus sat a Daoist adept, supremely adorned, unmatched in the world.
From the flowers emerged true-form Daoists, true-aspect Daoists, true-wisdom Daoists, dharma-joy Daoists, dharma-accomplished Daoists, dharma-liberated Daoists, dharma-blessed Daoists, dharma-true Daoists, dharma-delight Daoists, wondrous-adornment Daoists, wondrous-mind Daoists, wondrous-vision Daoists, wondrous-garden Daoists, wondrous-flower Daoists, and wondrous-aspect Daoists.
These Daoists gathered together, some walking, some sitting, some reclining, some standing, each producing wondrous sounds—playing phoenix flutes, zithers, harps, zhu, and konghou, while phoenixes, peacocks, lions, and white tigers roared and sang in harmonious melody.
Whether male or female, all who followed the sound beheld the hells, the animal realms, the hungry ghosts, and all beings, human and non-human, who rejoiced as one.

Then the Heavenly Venerable expounded for all sentient beings the treasury of the single vehicle. He taught the luminous canons of the Three Caverns, the cinnabar scriptures, and the accomplishment of the three vehicles for the benefit of all.
He spoke of leaving the household life, sitting in the empty city adorned with the seven treasures, and turning the wondrous Dharma wheel.
Having turned the Dharma wheel, all the people of that land and all sentient beings received benefit: the blind saw forms, the deaf heard sounds, the mute spoke, the lame walked, the poor became rich, and poverty and wealth were equalized. Those who disbelieved came to believe.
Thus, boundless multitudes of sentient beings cultivated the treasury of the single-vehicle, Haikong’s wisdom.

At that time, gods, dragons, ghosts, and spirits—celestial dragons and aerial ghosts, the eight fierce deities of the swift steed, Qiang, Hu, Di, and Lao peoples, humans and non-humans—all joined their voices in praise, saying:
“Excellent, excellent, Supreme Heavenly Venerable! You have brought great benefit to all.”
Having spoken thus, they leapt and rejoiced, some singing, some dancing, bowing in reverence, circumambulating, and extolling him. They burned incense, scattered flowers, raised banners and canopies, and played music of manifold wondrous sounds, filling the seat with their offerings.
They made offerings to the Heavenly Venerable, the Great Compassionate Heavenly Venerable, lamenting:
“We, dwelling in borderlands, bear human form yet lack the seed of wisdom. How is it that You, upon the seven-jeweled terrace of Haikong’s vehicle, expound the treasury of the single-vehicle wisdom for all sentient beings? Such rarity is difficult to see, difficult to hear. How can it be said that even Your own body suffers illness?”

chunks.original_text: 唯愿天尊分别解说，令众见明。 尔时，天尊答天龙曰：善哉善哉，善男子，汝已具足智慧甚深，能为净供，种种香花，种种甘味，种种伎乐，种种宝幢。 善男子，汝已成就智慧辩才，已曾供养无量无边三世天尊。 是故汝今善能香 净，种种供养。 善男子，我於过去无量无边，幽幽冥冥，龙汉、赤明，随劫出号，无名无形，为诸天人说是一乘海空智藏，开示分别，思惟义味，为众敷演，读诵书写，装演绦轴，流通徧於十方世界，一切众生悉得利益。 善男子，我从是来未曾有恶、烦恼业障，未曾诽谤，未曾不信，未曾违逆，未曾破毁。 从是以来，身心安乐，无诸苦恼。 善男子，汝等众生住烦恼城，多诸病恼，腹病心病，不知一乘秘密之藏，随语方便，谓言海空腹病心病。 天龙汝言，海空智藏是大法师，为众说法，而海空者，实非海空。 天龙汝言，海空智藏，而智藏者，实非智藏。 天龙汝言，海空智藏是真是仙，而海空者，实非真仙。 天龙汝言，海空智藏是人是兽，是鸟是虫，是草是木，是水是火，是石是土，而海空者，实非人兽，实非鸟虫，实非草木，实非水火，实非土石。 如是等说，皆是海空秘密之藏。 善男子，汝言海空犹如海水，而海空者，实非咸味。 汝言海空犹如父母、兄弟、妻子，而海空者，实非父母、兄弟、妻子。 汝言海空是大船师，能度大海，而海空者，实非大船，非度大海。 汝言海空腹病心病，而海空者，实非病病。 汝言海空住七宝城，而海空者，实非住住。 汝言海空启请药方，而海空者实非启请。 以如是空，是海空智藏，是海空城。 是时天尊说是语已，座中众生，若男若女，发平等心，善能修治身口意业，当舍命时，亲嘱父母、兄弟、夫妻，当取尸骨，或於水中，或於火聚，或於山野，豺狼虎豹，鸱枭鸳鸯，竞共食啖。 是其魂神心意爽识，即生善道、人中国王，化度一切，普天治人，善心供养一乘海空智慧宝藏。 尔时，国中有一长者，名曰法胜，而於座中四大疼痛，倚卧床席，终日终夜，不索饮食，命似欲终，家亲、妻子围绕涕哭。 长者嘱言：汝勤家业，慈心布施。 今我病源，将似命终，但生老死，死何可辞？ 於是妻子闻是语已，加复号叫，动於座所。 是时众中若大若小，各共弹指，唱言海空秘藏之力，云何众生悲心切恸？ 尔时，长者忽便瘥愈，如非病时。 於是长者心自念言：一乘海空威神之力，巍巍堂堂，三界奇尊，难可思议。 我今思惟一乘海空，是我形寿，是我命资，是我惠饭，是我法浆，我当云何？ 於是即选家亲、子孙，若男若女，聪慧上哲，一十三人，遣令出家，修治《一乘海空智藏》，烧香礼拜，书写读诵，思惟义味，为众敷演。 复以金车、银车、玉车、珊瑚、琥珀、真珠等车，复有米仓、盐仓、五谷诸仓，绫罗、锦绮、纹缯等彩，悉皆布施； 牛马驴骡，四散游意，造诸灵台七宝明观，房廓重阁，前堂后堂，前殿后殿，七宝九重微妙灵台，七宝九重微妙楼阁，四方重迭。 筝筑箜篌，音声相和，隐隐阗阗。 於是国人，或老或少，经过靖所，各自叹言：善哉善哉，功德巍巍，难可思议。 於是诸人各自发心，修造观舍，或大或小，随力供养，殿堂宝台，楼阁房廊。

May the Heavenly Venerable deign to expound and clarify, that all may see and understand.

Thereupon, the Heavenly Venerable replied to the heavenly dragons: Excellent, excellent, good man! You have already perfected profound wisdom, offering pure and manifold incense and flowers, manifold sweet flavors, manifold music, and manifold jeweled banners. Good man, you have attained wisdom and eloquence, having made offerings to measureless and boundless Heavenly Venerables of the three times. Therefore, you now skillfully purify with incense and make manifold offerings.

Good man, in the past, through measureless and boundless ages—dim and obscure, in the Longhan and Chiming kalpas—I appeared under various names, formless and nameless, expounding for gods and humans this single-vehicle treasury of Haikong’s wisdom. I revealed and distinguished it, pondered its meaning and flavor, and for the multitude unfolded, recited, transcribed, and adorned its scrolls, disseminating it throughout the ten directions of the world, so that all sentient beings received benefit.

Good man, from that time until now, I have never harbored evil, afflictive karmic obstructions, never slandered, never disbelieved, never opposed, never destroyed. Since that time, body and mind have been at peace, free from all suffering and distress.

Good man, you sentient beings dwell in the city of afflictions, beset by manifold illnesses and torments—abdominal ailments and heart ailments—unaware of the secret treasury of the single vehicle. Following expedient speech, you say that Haikong suffers from abdominal and heart ailments. Heavenly dragons, you say that the treasury of Haikong’s wisdom is a great dharma master expounding the teaching for the multitude, yet Haikong is not truly Haikong. Heavenly dragons, you say that the treasury of wisdom is the treasury of wisdom, yet the treasury of wisdom is not truly the treasury of wisdom. Heavenly dragons, you say that the treasury of Haikong’s wisdom is a true immortal, yet Haikong is not truly an immortal. Heavenly dragons, you say that the treasury of Haikong’s wisdom is human or beast, bird or insect, grass or tree, water or fire, stone or earth, yet Haikong is not truly human or beast, not truly bird or insect, not truly grass or tree, not truly water or fire, not truly earth or stone. Such expressions are all the secret treasury of Haikong.

Good man, you say that Haikong is like the waters of the sea, yet Haikong is not truly saline. You say that Haikong is like father, mother, brothers, wife, or children, yet Haikong is not truly father, mother, brothers, wife, or children. You say that Haikong is a great shipmaster, able to ferry across the great sea, yet Haikong is not truly a great ship, nor does he ferry across the great sea. You say that Haikong suffers from abdominal and heart ailments, yet Haikong is not truly afflicted by illness. You say that Haikong dwells in a seven-jeweled city, yet Haikong does not truly dwell. You say that Haikong requests a prescription, yet Haikong does not truly make requests. Through such emptiness is the treasury of Haikong’s wisdom, the city of Haikong.

When the Heavenly Venerable had spoken thus, the assembly—men and women alike—awakened the mind of equanimity. Skillfully cultivating the karma of body, speech, and mind, at the time of death, they entrusted their parents, brothers, and spouses: when my body is taken, let my bones be cast into water, or into a pyre, or upon the mountains and wilds, where jackals, wolves, tigers, and leopards, owls, and mandarin ducks will vie to devour them. Yet their souls, minds, and consciousnesses, bright and clear, will be reborn in the good destinies, in the human realm as kings, transforming and liberating all, governing the world with benevolence, and making offerings with a good heart to the single-vehicle treasury of Haikong’s wisdom.

At that time, in the kingdom there was an elder named Fasheng, who, in the assembly, was afflicted by the four great pains, lying propped upon his bed, day and night without seeking food or drink, his life seeming near its end. His family and wife surrounded him, weeping. The elder entrusted them: Tend diligently to the household affairs, and practice compassionate giving. Now my illness has reached its source, and my life is nearing its end. Birth, aging, and death—how can death be avoided? Hearing these words, his wife and children wailed even more, stirring the assembly. Then, young and old among the multitude snapped their fingers, exclaiming: By the power of the secret treasury of Haikong, how can sentient beings grieve so bitterly?

Suddenly, the elder was cured, as if never afflicted. Thereupon, the elder thought to himself: The majestic and awe-inspiring spiritual power of the single-vehicle Haikong, the wondrous and peerless honor of the three realms, is inconceivable. Now I contemplate the single-vehicle Haikong—it is my bodily life, my vital resource, my alms-food, my dharma-drink. What shall I do? Then he selected from his family and descendants—men and women, thirteen in all, wise and sagacious—and sent them forth to leave the household life, to cultivate the *Treasury of the Single-Vehicle Haikong’s Wisdom*, burning incense, making prostrations, transcribing, reciting, pondering its meaning and flavor, and expounding it for the multitude.

He further donated golden chariots, silver chariots, jade chariots, coral, amber, and pearl chariots, as well as granaries of rice, salt, and the five grains, silks of damask, brocade, and figured weaves, all freely given. Oxen, horses, donkeys, and mules were set loose to roam. He constructed spirit terraces and seven-jeweled luminous halls, chambers and galleries, front halls and rear halls, front palaces and rear palaces, nine-tiered seven-jeweled wondrous spirit terraces, nine-tiered seven-jeweled wondrous pavilions, layered in all four directions. Zithers, harps, and konghous harmonized, their sounds deep and resonant.

Then, people of the kingdom—old and young—passing by the tranquil site, each sighed: Excellent, excellent! Such merit is majestic and inconceivable. Thereupon, each awakened their own resolve, constructing halls and dwellings, large or small, making offerings according to their means—palaces, jeweled terraces, pavilions, and galleries.

chunks.original_text: 於是诸堂复有明师，集众讲说一乘海空秘密之藏。 尔时，国中，若男若女，有善心者，读诵《一乘海空智藏》一字一句，一行一偈，称其名号海空智藏者，如是诸人，即得人天，逍遥欢乐，不堕地狱、畜生、饿鬼，离众恼疾，入一乘藏。 是名希有称其名号。 善男子，若有众生闻经名字，闻已敬信，如是诸人，所有一切烦恼重病，皆悉除灭。 不信诽谤之罪#1譬如妙药，虽能疗愈种种重病，而不能治已死之人。 尔时，海空白天尊言：云何灭罪，断除诽谤不信之人？ 云何得善，随作随受？ 云何平等一心修行一乘宝藏？ 天尊答言：善男子，云何随作随受？ 善男子，若有众生发露忏悔，从生死际，所作诸恶皆悉发露，至於无罪。 以是因缘，是名所受。 善男子、譬如大王巡行正路，其中空城悉皆逃走，如是发露一切诸恶，亦复如是。 善男子，云何不灭诽谤者？ 若有众生，不信一乘海空智藏，作憍慢心，虽作众恶，於是作恶，永无回向。 以是义故，不入一乘，不灭诽谤。 善男子，纵使一心，无量众生一时得入海空智藏。 以是因缘，不见一人诽谤不信，得入一乘海空智藏。 以是之故，不信之人，不灭诽谤。 复次，善男子，云何平等一心，修行一乘宝藏？ 若有众生，或行或坐，思念大乘，不见我相，不见他相，不见大相，不见小相，长短白黑等相，如是，之相，亦无相想，平等一乘，犹如虚空，无大无小，无圣无凡。 何以故？ 若有人言，是我身者，即是道种，即是道性。 有道性故，身中即有七十二相、八十一好。 是故我说不异圣人天尊金口玉简之说。 善男子，若如是说，即是海空，即是智藏，於无量劫离诸烦恼，得见海空平等之相。 何以故？ 我今所说，实无我相，亦无我我，亦无我所。 以是因缘，随文而说，究竟平等。 善男子，譬如伎师，种种巧作，随其王命，往他国土，丧其身命，亦不敢违。 智者说言，一切众生皆有道性，故随缘而说，不惜身命，亦如伎师，不违王命，亦复如是。 复次，善男子，若有众生不信一乘海空宝藏，谓言不善，非彼所说，非真实言。 善男子，若有众生作如是说，是恶知识，是大五逆。 如此之人，不可亲近，不共居止。 何以故？
